thread.title: Blue Jays fans prepare for 'new season' as playoffs kick off this week
thread.title_full: Blue Jays fans prepare for 'new season' as playoffs kick off this week | Toronto Star

author: THESTAR.COM
title: Blue Jays fans prepare for 'new season' as playoffs kick off this week
text:
Get ready, Toronto — in case you hadn’t heard, the Blue Jays are in the playoffs for the first time in 22 years. And as the action kicks off later this week, the buzz has been mounting steadily on social media.
The season didn’t end the way the team may have wanted, with a 12-3 loss to the Tampa Bay Rays on Sunday.
But it was the Jays’ decision to start Mark Buerhle — who was just two innings shy of registering 200 innings pitched for the 15th-straight season — that had people talking.
Was it a classy move? Or were you left wondering what the Jays coaching staff was thinking?
Meanwhile, fans have continued to heap love on the team.
Did you catch Kevin Pillar’s Superman-like, diving catch on Saturday?
What about the question everyone — including his own teammates — is asking: Is Marcus Stroman wearing a long shirt, or a skirt?
Even Halloween pumpkins are cheering on the Blue Jays.
Favourite city councillor Norm Kelly assured the city that “ the Taylor Swift ‘curse’ will have no effect ” on the Jays. Swift herself even cheered for the team during her concert at the Rogers Centre over the weekend.
But not everyone was so sure. “Jays are 0-2 since Taylor Swift performed at the Rogers Centre. The curse is real,” someone wrote on Twitter . “Maybe that Taylor Swift curse thing is legit…” Sportsnet’s Jackie Redmond commented .
But the Blue Jays players aren’t letting a few losses to end the regular season get them down. In fact, the Toronto sluggers are carrying the excitement and good spirits they have become known for into their American League Division Series versus the Texas Rangers, which kicks off on Thursday.
These guys are heat @encadwin @davidprice14 @russellmartin55 #Tulo #BigDaddy be on the lookout this week on @sportsillustrated
A photo posted by Jose Bautista (@joeybats19) on Oct 4, 2015 at 10:27am PDT
“Back to the 6,” outfielder Marcus Stroman wrote Sunday night . “Thursday and Friday can’t come soon enough. City better be turned all the way up. It’s a new season, and we still breathin’!”
